scan_table_check.description: A Script Include that does neither starts with "function", "class" nor "var" may unintendedly inject symbols into the global namespace - which may lead to unintended side-effects when the code is being executed. Script Includes should always contain exactly one function or class definition. In addition, the function or class must be named exactly like the Script Include itself.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - Script Include must contain a class or function
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Refactor the code in the Script Include to contain either a function or a class of the same name like the Script Include.
scan_table_check.short_description: A Script Include must start with "function", "var" or "class to avoid globals
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - Script Include must contain a class or function
